info.name: Artifact Store
info.description: # Introduction This is artifact store API. This is a global configuration for to artifactory authentication related information. ## Image ![m'lady](http://i.imgur.com/v8IVDka.jpg) --- ## List * Milk * Bread * Wholegrain * Butter * --- ## Ordered list 1. Tidy the kitchen 2. Prepare ingredients 3. Cook delicious things ## Blockquote > To be or not to be, that is the question. ## Headers # Header 1 ## Header 2 ### Header 3 #### Header 4 ##### Header 5 ## Table | Tables | Are | Cool | | ------------- |:-------------:| -----:| | col 3 is | right-aligned | $1600 | | col 2 is | centered | $12 | | zebra stripes | are neat | $1 | ## Emphasis Emphasis, aka italics, with *asterisks* or _underscores_. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with **asterisks** or __underscores__. Combined emphasis with **asterisks and _underscores_**. Strikethrough uses two tildes. ~~Scratch this.~~ ## Links [I'm an inline-style link](https://www.google.com) [I'm an inline-style link with title](https://www.google.com "Google's Homepage") [I'm a reference-style link][Arbitrary case-insensitive reference text] [I'm a relative reference to a repository file](../blob/master/LICENSE) [You can use numbers for reference-style link definitions][1] Or leave it empty and use the [link text itself]. URLs and URLs in angle brackets will automatically get turned into links. http://www.example.com or and sometimes example.com (but not on Github, for example). Some text to show that the reference links can follow later. [arbitrary case-insensitive reference text]: https://www.mozilla.org [1]: http://slashdot.org [link text itself]: http://www.reddit.com ## Inline code Inline `code` has `back-ticks around` it. ## Code block ```javascript var s = "JavaScript syntax highlighting"; alert(s); ``` ```python s = "Python syntax highlighting" print s ``` ``` No language indicated, so no syntax highlighting. But let's throw in a tag. ```

request.description: Get a artifact store with specified id in path param # Introduction This is artifact store API. This is a global configuration for to artifactory authentication related information. ## Image ![m'lady](http://i.imgur.com/v8IVDka.jpg) --- ## List * Milk * Bread * Wholegrain * Butter * --- ## Ordered list 1. Tidy the kitchen 2. Prepare ingredients 3. Cook delicious things ## Blockquote > To be or not to be, that is the question. ## Headers # Header 1 ## Header 2 ### Header 3 #### Header 4 ##### Header 5 ## Table | Tables | Are | Cool | | ------------- |:-------------:| -----:| | col 3 is | right-aligned | $1600 | | col 2 is | centered | $12 | | zebra stripes | are neat | $1 | ## Emphasis Emphasis, aka italics, with *asterisks* or _underscores_. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with **asterisks** or __underscores__. Combined emphasis with **asterisks and _underscores_**. Strikethrough uses two tildes. ~~Scratch this.~~ ## Links [I'm an inline-style link](https://www.google.com) [I'm an inline-style link with title](https://www.google.com "Google's Homepage") [I'm a reference-style link][Arbitrary case-insensitive reference text] [I'm a relative reference to a repository file](../blob/master/LICENSE) [You can use numbers for reference-style link definitions][1] Or leave it empty and use the [link text itself]. URLs and URLs in angle brackets will automatically get turned into links. http://www.example.com or and sometimes example.com (but not on Github, for example). Some text to show that the reference links can follow later. [arbitrary case-insensitive reference text]: https://www.mozilla.org [1]: http://slashdot.org [link text itself]: http://www.reddit.com ## Inline code Inline `code` has `back-ticks around` it. ## Code block ```javascript var s = "JavaScript syntax highlighting"; alert(s); ``` ```python s = "Python syntax highlighting" print s ``` ``` No language indicated, so no syntax highlighting. But let's throw in a tag. ```
